item.title: Algorithmic Social Media is broken.
item.description: A video by Hank Green sparked me to re-iterate how important it is to use social media that doesn’t own you.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: I miss Aperture 3
item.description: I remember watching this video after installing Aperture. The app came on a DVD with a license key printed on the back, thats how long ago this was!
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: On not buying the new Mac Mini
item.description: In this semi-rant I explore why I decided not to buy a new Mac Mini M4, and how you can buy one without going crazy or spending too much.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: [Insert important person here] congratulates Trump
item.description: In this post I reflect on my feelings watching the queue of CEOs and politicians congratulating Trump.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Apple’s recent Apple Intelligence ads are disturbing
item.description: Apple’s recent ads for Apple Intelligence make my nails curl and my stomach turn. I think they are actually hurting Apple’s brand.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Here is to sanity!
item.description: Who is more likely to care about your voice after the election? A wanna-be-dictator that is serving his last legal term in office, or Kamala, who will want to be re-elected in 2028?
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Two years ago I left Twitter and joined Mastodon
item.description: In this post I reflect on two years of Mastodon, Musk Twitter, and the impact of Threads’ algorithm.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: European GDPR Hypocrisy
item.description: I was miffed about cookie banners that force visitors to pay for access or accept third-party cookies. While writing this post I had to accept that I had no right to be.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Apple’s UI Hide and Seek on macOS
item.description: I found that a UI component of macOS was hidden but functional in Safari.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: I wish Apple Mail had PGP support!
item.description: An open letter to the team working on Apple Mail @ Apple.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Europe’s IT problem / How GDPR and DMA have unintended consequences
item.description: In this text I explore how the DMA and GDPR are having unintended consequences for the EU market. I explore several concrete examples to illustrate some of the less desirable outcomes.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Apple Intelligence and Electron Apps
item.description: Apple Intelligence enhances macOS apps built with native technologies like SwiftUI, while Electron apps, which are essentially web apps, will miss out on these improvements.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Thoughts on Apple Intelligence
item.description: In this article I compare Apple Intelligence to Notion AI. I explain how Apple Intelligence is different from others like ChatGPT, and attempt to highlight how it faces similar, but reduced privacy risks.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Apple Intelligence and the DMA
item.description: What does the DMA mean for Europe and companies operating within it? In this article I look at the legislative differences between the US and EU and what this means for Apple Intelligence and the European market.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: The WWDC 2024 keynote invite email hints at a gaming or movie focused event
item.description: WWDC 2024 invites hint at a focus on gaming, I think. The German version suggests games and movies specifically.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Unlearning how to code (and think)
item.description: I tried putting into words some of my concerns about AI in programming and thinking. I fear that using AI to generate code potentially pushes knowledgable engineers out of the field, causes security issues, and makes maintenance harder.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Siri has definitely gotten worse
item.description: A conversation about the weather—with Siri.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Gruber is mad about Spotify and the EU, again.
item.description: John Gruber wrote a piece about EU regulation and Spotify dripping with grumpy sarcasm. I asked AI to describe his behavior and word choices in some recent articles and it told me he was biased and had a protectionist attitude.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Being late to the AI-Party is good for Apple
item.description: Google's new "AI Overview" feature in search results once more highlights the limitations of LLMs. I think Apple, on the other hand, integrates AI and ML subtly and effectively, enhancing functionality without the risks of generative AI.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Do early adopters overestimate their importance?
item.description: I believe the thesis that people won’t upgrade as often because Apple's M-Series Macs are too good is flawed. It contains unfounded assumptions and overlooks how technology sometimes progresses.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Apple’s attention to detail with the Apple Pencil Pro is awesome!
item.description: In a video, Quinn Nelson demos the virtual shadow of the Apple Pencil Pro.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Lost thoughts, or: Where to publish?
item.description: I regret not writing down more thoughts outside platforms like Twitter in the past decade — despite my embarrassing early blogging days before making an account there.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: "Link in Bio" encourages copyright infringement
item.description: Some “social” platforms block links to maximize profit. This practice promotes the spread of stolen content, but you can fight it.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Thoughts on the scarcity of time
item.description: You can’t save time for later and you only get 24 hours a day. Here is how I changed my life to adapt it to this fundamental truth.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Why I’ll buy a new iPhone, despite disliking it
item.description: The iPhone, in my opinion, is the best smartphone available. While I have reservations about the camera mountain, I still prefer it over any Android phone.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: How Apple is killing iMessage in Europe
item.description: This is an open letter to the Messages team at Apple. I argue that iMessage's closed nature and the, according to rumors, standalone RCS app harms iMessage’s popularity in Europe.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Apple software quality and declining Mac sales
item.description: Tim Cook believes that the Mac's recent sales slump could improve with the introduction of the M3 chip. I think he’s wrong and suspect that declining software quality from Apple is hurting Mac sales.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Wishlist for an iPhone design refresh
item.description: The iPhone 15 announcement left me feeling disappointed, so I spent some time to ask myself what would have excited me. Colorful designs, like the iPhone 5C, and a different camera are my main wishes for a new iPhone.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Some AI companies steal. Here is how you can stop them.
item.description: AI companies like OpenAI, Meta, and Alphabet use data available online to train their AI/LLM models without compensation or permission. In this post I propose using `.htaccess` to lock them out.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: After Twitter
item.description: My transition from Twitter to Mastodon changed how I use Social Media. I suspect that many may opt to leave social media altogether, recognizing its potential harm.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Hey Siri → Hey GPT
item.description: Make Siri useful by replacing it with OpenAI's GPT. Follow the steps to set it up and start using ChatGPT through Siri on your iPhone.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Apple Podcasts’ ads in foreign languages
item.description: Podcasts on Apple Podcasts are interrupted by ads in foreign languages. This is annoying, and Apple should just use my language preferences from my Apple ID or device settings.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Twitter needs money
item.description: Twitter's recent changes may worsen the platform for both paying and non-paying users. The move, presented as intended to combat AI spam, is likely a strategy to boost Twitter Blue subscriptions.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Where is Apple in the AI race?
item.description: The Copilot expansion into Office 365 highlights the competitive advantage AI tools can provide. Apple's impressive on-device processing power suggests it might introduce offline AI soon.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Improving Apple’s UX: Subscription Edition
item.description: Subscribing to Apple TV+ via the macOS TV App unexpectedly resulted in a subscription to AppleOne instead. This confused me until I realized Apple had selected the cheaper option without asking.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Verschlimmbesserung
item.description: "Verschlimmbesserung" describes an attempted improvement that ends up making things worse. In German, the Word emphasizes the positive intention unlike its English counterpart "disimprovement".
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Twitter‘s progressing infirmity
item.description: Musk’s cost-cutting measures at Twitter resulted in brain-drain and a loss of access to Slack. This caused disruptions in the company’s knowledge on work processes.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: The ROI of Social Media
item.description: When we use social media, we invest time, mental energy, and idle brain time, but the returns on this investment vary. How can we optimize our time spent for the return we want?
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Twitter: A Snapshot
item.description: Old newspapers or computers can provide insights into the past. Digitally ephemeral platforms like Twitter may deprive future generations of this experience.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: Apple‘s rumored AR/VR/XR Headset
item.description: The rumor mill is running hot about Apple's potential AR/VR headset. The success would hinge on its usefulness and engaging developers to adopt it.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: The end of the WebKit exclusive on iOS?
item.description: In anticipation of new EU regulation, Mozilla is working on bringing Firefox to iOS using its own rendering engine. Google's Chromium team is also working on a new iOS browser based on Blink.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: On the deterioration of search results
item.description: Google searches used to yield clear and useful results, but content farms have cluttered search results with spam. Products like ChatGPT could put Google and SEO-gurus out of business.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: It was too late, Twitter did it anyway
item.description: Twitter quietly discontinued third-party APIs, breaking paid third party apps. The controversy within the community highlighted the platform's struggle to adapt and innovate.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag

item.title: UX Critique, Apple Music Replay 2022
item.description: Apple Music introduced "Replay 2022," akin to Spotify Wrapped. I was surprised how well it highlighted music I like, but Apple's oversights in UX testing made it a nightmare to use.
item.dc:creator: Wenzel Massag
